alert.note: Alert for Lassen-Eastern Plumas-Eastern Sierra Counties (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 30 at 2:05PM PST until January 01 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Reno
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM SATURDAY TO 4 AM PST SUNDAY ABOVE 6000 FEET... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected above 6000 feet. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 12 inches, except 1 to 2 feet above 7000 feet. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...Lassen-Eastern Plumas-Eastern Sierra Counties. * WHEN...From 4 AM Saturday to 4 AM PST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Heavy rainfall is likely for most elevations, with the exception of areas above 7,500 feet which may see a mixture of rain and/or heavy wet Sierra cement. Snow levels begin to fall Saturday morning into early afternoon.
info.instruction: Avoid travel if possible, you could be stuck in your vehicle for many hours. If you must travel, prepare for long delays and carry an emergency kit with extra food, water, clothing and tire chains. Once the storm arrives, travel may be difficult or impossible for an extended period of time. If you stay home, have a backup plan in case of power outages. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
